subject: Technology
title: Facebook: From Dorm Room to Domination
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Facebook: From Dorm Room to Domination.

hook.text: A Harvard student built a website to rate classmates' attractiveness. It became the most powerful media company in history.

buildup.text: Mark Zuckerberg launched Facebook in 2004, limited to Harvard students. Exclusivity made it feel special.

discovery.text: Facebook expanded to all colleges, then everyone. The News Feed, launched in 2006, kept users scrolling for hours.

twist.text: Facebook didn't just connect friends. It became the primary news source for billions, without any editorial standards.

climax.text: With nearly 3 billion monthly users, Facebook reshaped communication, politics, and information globally.

punchline.text: A college hot-or-not site became the world's town square.

quiz.question: What made Facebook's early growth strategy effective?
options: Exclusivity by limiting access to college students first
